conference.title: 13th APOCP Regional Conference
conference.subtitle: Dedicated to the 75th anniversary of Kokshetau Higher Medical College

about_event.title: About event
about_event.description:
Asia-Pacific Organization for Cancer Prevention (APOCP) аймақтық конференциясы онкологиядағы эпидемиология, алдын алу және паллиативтік көмек мәселелерін талқылау үшін жетекші сарапшыларды, дәрігерлерді, мейірбикелерді және ғалымдарды біріктіреді.

Ерекше назар — орта медициналық қызметкерлердің рөлін дамытуға, көпсалалы тәсілді ілгерілетуге және халықаралық ынтымақтастықты нығайтуға аударылады. Ұйымдастырушы: Көкшетау жоғары медицина колледжі.
Конференцияға Қазақстан, Үндістан, Қытай, Индонезия, Иран, Таиланд, Қырғызстан және басқа елдердің мамандары мен тәжірибешілері шақырылады.

program.title: PROGRAM
program.description: Check out the event program. Here you will find the schedule of presentations, workshops, and other activities.

welcome_1.body: It is a great honor for me, as President of the Asia-Pacific Organization for Cancer Prevention (APOCP) Regional Conference, to welcome you to this important event, held on October 2–3, 2025, in Kokshetau city, Republic of Kazakhstan, and dedicated to the 75th anniversary of Kokshetau Higher Medical College. In an era marked by rapid technological transformation and global health challenges, this conference serves as a vital scientific and professional platform: fostering knowledge exchange, expanding interdisciplinary collaboration, and strengthening regional partnerships in the fields of oncology and nursing. This event represents a key milestone in our collective mission: to reduce the cancer burden; to elevate the role of nursing professionals; and to enhance healthcare systems through innovation, equity in care delivery, and the development of sustainable infrastructure. As we move forward in a post-pandemic world, transformative technologies: including AI-assisted diagnostics, molecular profiling, personalized therapies, and digital health integration; are reshaping oncology practice. However, at the heart of lasting change lies the collaboration between science, policy, and clinical communities to implement effective and sustainable cancer control strategies. I would like to express my sincere appreciation to the Department of Public Health of the Akmola Region and Kokshetau Higher Medical College for their outstanding organization and ongoing commitment. Their efforts have turned this conference into a true hub of international cooperation and professional exchange. To all participants: Your dedication and expertise in epidemiology, molecular oncology, digital health, nursing, and palliative care are critical to the transformation of cancer care across the Asia-Pacific region. During these days, we will address innovations in liquid biopsy, telemedicine, community-based prevention strategies, and approaches to strengthening the nursing workforce. Let this conference not only enrich our professional knowledge but also give rise to actionable strategies that will define the future of cancer prevention, treatment, and nursing across our countries. Our vision of a cancer-free world calls for scientific integrity, political will, and, above all, unwavering commitment to humanism and cooperation: the values that bring us together here today.
welcome_1.closing: With Respect and Optimism, Dr. Nariman Yermek

welcome_2.greeting: Dear Participants and Guests of the Asia-Pacific Organization for Cancer Prevention (APOCP) Regional Conference, dedicated to the 75th Anniversary of Kokshetau Higher Medical College
welcome_2.body: On behalf of the Kokshetau Higher Medical College and the Organizing Committee, I am pleased to extend a warm welcome to all participants and guests who share a common mission: to strengthen international cooperation and advance innovative strategies in cancer care and nursing. The conference brings together leading scientists, clinicians, and healthcare professionals from across the Asia-Pacific region, including China, South Korea, India, Iran, Indonesia, Uzbekistan, Kyrgyzstan, and Kazakhstan. Their high level of expertise and international experience lend exceptional significance to this event. The program covers a wide range of pressing topics: from the epidemiology and prevention of cancer to the vital role of nursing professionals in implementing a multidisciplinary approach, delivering high-quality care, and providing palliative support. Special emphasis is placed on the integration of modern nursing technologies, human resource development, and the translation of scientific advances into clinical practice. This conference is intended to serve as an effective platform for sharing best practices, promoting evidence-based approaches, and developing collaborative solutions to the pressing challenges facing contemporary oncology and nursing. I am confident that the outcomes of this forum will inspire new professional and educational initiatives and contribute meaningfully to improving cancer care and nursing systems in our partner countries. I wish all participants fruitful work, constructive discussions, and significant scientific discoveries.
welcome_2.closing: With Respect and Optimism, Rustem Salkyuly Moldagali
